com.bigdata.rdf.sail.remote

Class BigdataSailFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.remote.BigdataSailFactory

  • public class BigdataSailFactory
extends Object
    Helper class to create a bigdata instance.
    Author:
    mikepersonick
    See Also:
    BigdataSailFactory must be moved to the client package

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BigdataSailFactory.Option
      A handy list of common Options you might want to specify when creating your bigdata instance.

    • Field Detail

      • BIGDATA_SAIL_INSTANCE

        public static final String BIGDATA_SAIL_INSTANCE
        The default bigdata SAIL_PROVIDER.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SAIL_PROVIDER

        public static final String SAIL_PROVIDER
        The name of the property to set with the class that will provide the Sail. It must have a constructor that takes a single properties file as the parameter.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static BigdataSailRemoteRepository connect(String host,
                                  int port)
        Connect to a remote bigdata instance. FIXME This does not parameterize the value of the ContextPath. See BigdataStatics.getContextPath().

      • connect

        public static BigdataSailRemoteRepository connect(String sparqlEndpointURL)
        Connect to a remote bigdata instance.
        Parameters:
        sparqlEndpointURL - The URL of the SPARQL end point. FIXME This does not support the HA load balancer pattern. See #1148. FIXME This does not parameterize the value of the ContextPath. See BigdataStatics.getContextPath(). FIXME This MIGHT leak HttpClient or Executor resources.

      • testServiceEndpointUrl

        @Deprecated
public static String testServiceEndpointUrl(String serviceEndpoint)
        Deprecated. 
        Convenience method to allow the testing of the URL normalization functionality.
        See Also:
        BigdataSailFactory.connect()

      • openRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository openRepository(String file)
        Open an existing persistent bigdata instance. If a journal does not exist at the specified location then an exception will be thrown.

      • openRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository openRepository(String file,
                                                        boolean create)
        Open an existing persistent bigdata instance. If a journal does not exist at the specified location and the boolean create flag is true a journal will be created at that location with the default set of options.

      • openSail

        public static org.openrdf.sail.Sail openSail(String file)
        Open an existing persistent bigdata instance. If a journal does not exist at the specified location then an exception will be thrown.

      • openSail

        public static org.openrdf.sail.Sail openSail(String file,
                             boolean create)
        Open an existing persistent bigdata instance. If a journal does not exist at the specified location and the boolean create flag is true a journal will be created at that location with the default set of options.

      • createRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository createRepository(BigdataSailFactory.Option... args)
        Create a new bigdata instance using the specified options. Since no journal file is specified this must be an in-memory instance.

      • createRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository createRepository(Properties props,
                                                          BigdataSailFactory.Option... args)
        Create a new bigdata instance using the specified options. Since no journal file is specified this must be an in-memory instance.
